name: Radioiodine-Refractory Differentiated Thyroid Cancer
chief_complaint: I still feel a lump in my neck after thyroid surgery and radioactive iodine treatment
prognosis: Variable depending on disease burden; 5-year survival ~65% with systemic therapy
description: A subset of differentiated thyroid cancers that lose iodine avidity and become resistant to radioactive iodine therapy, often requiring alternative systemic treatments. Typically presents with persistent/recurrent disease despite prior RAI treatment.
